phrases: Mari, are you going to study while we are at the beach?
Well, if I feel like it.
Bringing study stuff on a summer fun day?
Everyone enjoys themselves in different ways.
I am sure Mari will do a lot of studying,
and become a researcher just like her father!
I do not know about that.
Are you sure we can stay in this house?
My parents built it for fun.
It is a waste if we do not use it now and then.
Mari, take care of Rika, okay?
Are your parents from the Miwa Concern?
So you are very wealthy, are not you?
Waka, want to explore the rooms?
Do you think I could, too?
Could you look after Rika, then?
I think it is too high for me to reach...
The blue sky, the shining sea.
The salt air brushing my cheeks...
Summer days spent at an extravagant villa...
But why could not that jerk have come with us?
He said no because he had a soccer match.
It is hard being far away and not getting to see each other.
Hey, now, you will see him again when school starts.
Madam, is not it hard for you, not seeing your husband for three years?
Well, we met while I was abroad.
And when he went back to Japan, I stayed in Paris,
so we have gone a year at a time without seeing each other.
He loves to be free, and hates carrying things like cell phones.
So I am used to not being in touch with him.
He does not even have a cell phone?
But cell phones are a relatively recent invention.
So I find that rather normal.
When I was young, my husband did not have a cell phone.
We would end up waiting on either side of the Hachiko statue without seeing each other.
I think that is because you are you, Mom.
I wonder what Papa's doing now.
The Year 1876 (What is Now) Boston, America
I think someone is spreading rumors about me.
Thank you so much for coming to view our classes.
The honor is all mine, Mr. Bell.
The visible speech system your father invented was truly incredible!
Now, let us try speaking together.
You would not think those children were deaf.
I would love to bring it back to Brazil.
Could I have a few of your books?
I will send them to you.
She is hard of hearing, too.
If she cannot see your lips, she cannot understand what you are saying.
Beautiful lady, I must be going.
Now, let us head back to the classroom.
Thank you for your help before, Doctor...
You came all the way from Japan to see our classes?
Well, I saw that code of yours.
I thought it might be useful for learning pronunciation in different languages.
That is a rather strong handshake.
It is a telegram from Father.
He wants you to attend the exposition, after all.
But I told him it was impossible, did not I?
Alex, they are holding the Centennial Exposition in Philadelphia.
I made special arrangements so that you could exhibit
Of course, you can display your visual speech along with it.
Is not that wonderful, Dr. Bell?
If you demonstrate it at the exhibition,
it will spread awareness of the telephone,
and you will likely be able to make a business of it.
If you can do that, I will officially allow your marriage to my daughter.
I am sorry, sir, but that invention has room for improvement.
And I cannot neglect my school to perform the needed experiments.
You still have not changed your mind?
Until I have enough people that I can entrust this work to,
I cannot abandon my work as a teacher.
He who runs after two hares will catch neither.
You should focus on promoting the telephone.
But they are both important to me!
Then I will go to the exhibition myself.
You will allow me to display it, will not you?
He said that the display alone might not make the pitch to the judges.
That was not what we discussed.
I am sorry to do this in front of you.
No, I suppose we are both having trouble.
I am also the type to follow my own path,
no matter what my wife says to me.
Even if you love your wife?
Well, I guess they are different situations.
I love Mabel from the bottom of my heart.
But I just cannot bring myself to agree with her father.
In life, the question of what to prioritize
might be the eternal conflict, no matter how the era might change.
Oh, I mean, do your best.
Mr. Bell, I will be rooting for you.
And the day after that, he went away for six months.
He is gone missing before, then?
And this time it is three years?
But at least he is grown up enough to leave me a letter.
He would been missing for four or five days, so I went to his laboratory,
and found out he would gone on a research trip.
Shun, does that book have something to do with his research?
Shun, does that book have something to do with his research?
That brings a lot of things together, huh?
Hey, why do not we go swimming?
Come on, let us go swimming!
So you are here, Mrs. Hayase.
Your new almond praline cream puffs were delicious.
Thank you for your continued patronage.
This is Mr. Mikage, a customer at our store.
It is summer vacation, after all.
If I might, would you like to join me on a cruise?
I have a cabin cruiser at the marina.
As long as you are here, why do not we make a party of it?
I have just never been on a cabin cruiser.
Mama, what is a cabin cruiser?
Then why do not you all join us?
If you insist, then we ladies shall accompany you.
You are getting too carried away, Waka.
I just felt like acting like a lady.
Waka, you could be an actress.
But I am going to be a TV announcer!
So you have a real dream, huh, Waka?
And Shun, you want to be a doctor, right?
But lately, I have started to think there might be other possibilities.
You will not become a doctor?
Well, Mari, you work hard, too!
I do not even know what I want to be...
What is the meaning of this, Mabel?
I came because you said you had something to show me.
Give the demonstration at the exhibition, like Father wants!
I will not be able to marry you if you do not!
But you know very well that I have school...
The school will still be here when you get back!
But this exhibition will only come once.
You are getting on, are not you, Mr. Bell?
But I am still pursuing those two hares.
You always show up when Mabel needs you.
You are like her knight in shining armor.
I just felt like history might change
if you did not get on this train.
Well, no matter how I try to protect the flow of time,
some things may yet remain part of history.
But you cannot fight a woman's tears, can you?
Does that go for your wife's tears, too?
I have not seen her tears in quite a while.
I was just thinking about Papa.
Papa proposed to me on a beach near here.
He said that if you swear your love in front of that setting sun,
He would made it all up, of course.
But he said humans create whatever they imagine,
and so he was going to create that legend.
I wonder what he is doing right now.
The meat has cooked up nicely.
Shall I call you Akira, then?
Would you like to work on developing premium desserts?
I know a lot of gourmets for whom money is no object.
If you leave it to me, I could expand your business even further.
And of course, I am very focused on my art.
But I want to offer my sweets
at reasonable prices, so everyone can enjoy them.
There is no ambiguity with you, is there?
If I were a single woman...
Well, he is very handsome, is not he?
So Waka and her mom like that kind of guy, huh?
I did not say that, exactly...
There is no need to hold back.
Ms. Kuroki, we are out of meat, so could you move this out of the way?
Mari, could you get a change of clothes for Rika from my bag?
She was trying to steal it!
Shun, I am borrowing your book.
Did you hear something just now?
Whose page did I travel into?
The foundation of the telephone that Bell invented
is a connected pair of speakers like this.
It is not a microphone and a speaker?
The principle of the microphone and speaker is the same.
So when you speak into one of the speakers...
You can send the voice between speakers!
What is the principle behind it?
Sound is produced Vibrations in air Eardrum interprets the vibrations as sound
Do you know how hearing works?
Sound is produced Vibrations in air Eardrum interprets the vibrations as sound
Um, you speak, and the air vibrates, Sound is produced Vibrations in air Eardrum interprets the vibrations as sound
and that makes your eardrum shake, and then you can hear it, right?
Sound is produced Vibrations in air Eardrum interprets the vibrations as sound
Sound is produced Vibrations in air Eardrum interprets the vibrations as sound
It was Bell who thought of mechanically converting that into electric signals.
Sound is produced Vibrations in air Eardrum interprets the vibrations as sound
Transmitter Receiver Coil Electric current Magnet Paper cone (Diaphragm)
On the speaker's end, the voice makes the diaphragm shake, causing the coils to move.
Transmitter Receiver Coil Electric current Magnet Paper cone (Diaphragm)
Transmitter Receiver Coil Electric current Magnet Paper cone (Diaphragm)
In other words, it is changed the sound into an electric signal.
Transmitter Receiver Coil Electric current Magnet Paper cone (Diaphragm)
Just like the electromagnetic induction we did with Mr. Faraday?
Transmitter Receiver Coil Electric current Magnet Paper cone (Diaphragm)
Then the coil on the receiver's end reacts to the electric signal, Transmitter Receiver Coil Electric current Magnet Paper cone (Diaphragm)
and the diaphragm vibrates and creates sound.
Transmitter Receiver Coil Electric current Magnet Paper cone (Diaphragm)
Bell wanted to find a way to help deaf people hear.
That is how he thought of it.
So science can give form to people's feelings too, huh?
